elements.title: Julia Dawson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Julia Dawson's first Clarion Van (pictured) was named for Scottish socialist Caroline Martyn?

elements.title: a Phoenix radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Phoenix radio station served as the springboard for future Arizona governor Jack Williams and comedian Steve Allen?

elements.title: Sarah Traubel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that soprano Sarah Traubel appeared as Inanna in Jörg Widmann's Babylon for the opening of the 2022 Internationale Maifestspiele Wiesbaden?

elements.title: Burns & McDonnell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the engineering and architectural company Burns & McDonnell is 100% owned by its employees?

elements.title: Daniel Boyd (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that indigenous Australian artist Daniel Boyd has depicted colonial figures including Captain James Cook and Governor Arthur Phillip as pirates?

elements.title: There's a Honey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Matthew Healy and George Daniel of The 1975 helped make Pale Waves's debut single, "There's a Honey", "sonically bigger"?

elements.title: an episode (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an episode of the children's TV show Arthur featuring a same-sex wedding was not aired on Alabama's PBS network?

elements.title: Dead Cells (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dead Cells was published in early access because the developers feared that there would be an "indiepocalypse"?
